sentences.en: ...a type of bacteria that include the microbes responsible for tuberculosis and leprosy.
sentences.cn: …包括引起结核病和麻风病的微生物在内的一类细菌。

sentences.en: A microbe that uses left - handed DNA could exist unrecognised.
sentences.cn: DNA结构向左旋的微生物是否存在尚不得知.

sentences.en: Abstract: This article discussed the research progress of microbe degradation of pesticides.
sentences.cn: 文摘: 本文讨论了农药微生物降解的研究进展.

sentences.en: Acetochlor and atrazine all belong to the lower poisonous pesticide on soil microbe.
sentences.cn: 它们对土壤微生物的安全性属于低毒级或无实际危害级农药.

sentences.en: How can you coax a microbe to communicate?
sentences.cn: 你如何才能让微生物向我们表达 呢 ?

sentences.en: Microbe assimilation plays a leading role in the intermittent reaction.
sentences.cn: 间歇反应中微生物同化作用占主导地位.

sentences.en: Mutual competition and mutual dependence relations coexisted among all the microbe populations.
sentences.cn: 这些微生物之间存在着相互竞争、相互依存关系.

sentences.cn: 4.微生物菌群多样性: 有多种霉菌、细菌、酵母等.

sentences.en: The fermented citrus pulp by microbe was used as the pig feed.
sentences.cn: 猪只经屠宰解剖表明,发酵柑桔渣作猪饲料无任何毒副作用.

sentences.en: The food microbe poisoning often come from the course of food production.
sentences.cn: 微生物污染最为严重的食品是肉及肉制品和豆制品.

sentences.en: The formation temperature controls the physiological activity of the microbe and the production of the methane.
sentences.cn: 分析了地层温度、咸化环境和还原环境等因素对阳信洼陷沙一段生物气生成、聚集和保存的控制作用.

sentences.en: The microbe, pollutants and environmental effect factors are discussed in the paper.
sentences.cn: 微生物 、 染物及环境等方面的因素都影响着生物降解效率.

sentences.en: The probe is sensitive enough to detect the presence of a single microbe.
sentences.cn: 这个探针的灵敏度很高,足以测出任何微生物的存在.

sentences.en: The professor initiated students into the mysteries of microbe.
sentences.cn: 教授将微生物的奥秘传授给学生们.

sentences.en: The tears also contain a potent microbe - killer called lysozyme, which guards me from infective bacteria.
sentences.cn: 眼泪里还包含一种叫做溶菌酶的高效力杀菌者, 保护我不受细菌感染.

sentences.en: Wine is nourishing beverage and is liable to microbe diseases.
sentences.cn: 葡萄酒是营养丰富的饮料,很容易发生微生物病害.

words.tran_cn: 微生物的；由细菌引起的

trans.tran_en: an extremely small living thing which you can only see if you use a  microscope  . Some microbes can cause diseases.
